title: Man Fined Rs 12,000 For Not Following Traffic Rules & Drinking Water While Driving
text:
A man in Queensland claimed that he was fined Rs 12,294 ($173) for not following traffic rules and just think which rule did he break? He just drank a sip of water while driving! The incident happened when Brock Harris was driving home to Beaudesert, about 70 km from Brisbane, after a 12-hour work day, he told ABC Radio Brisbane.

He claimed that he took a sip from a 600 ml plastic bottle of water as he was turning into his street, which is when the police officer pulled him over. "As I was pulling into my street I was pulled over by the police and told it was illegal to drink anything while driving," he told ABC's Rebecca Levingston.

According to the reports, Harris said that the fine was a result of him “not paying due care and attention”. "If it is against the law then I'll pay the fine, but it's not compassionate to fine someone on a 39C day [for trying to] stay hydrated," he said.

"The policeman told me there was nothing I could do and he was doing his job — but I am going to challenge the fine."

A Queensland Police spokesperson told news.com.au that the fines were usually issued if the action causes the driver to not be in control of the vehicle. Queensland Police Superintendent David Johnson’s told ABC news, there were many drivers who consume drinks safely while on the road.

"For us to issue a fine we have to look at the circumstances to see if the driver's actions are causing risks to themselves or others," he said.
